intro: Acinodendron longispicatum, commonly known as the long-spined acinodendron, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds. Acinodendron longispicatum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
